#Text=Yuko Kawai
#Text=Yuko Kawai ( 河合優子 , Kawai Yūko , born in Nagoya , 20 October ) is a Japanese classical pianist .
#Text=She gave the world premiere of Chopin Piano Concertos in E minor Op. 11 and F minor Op. 21 in the version for one piano as published in the National Edition . [ 1 ]
#Text=Education

#Text=After graduating from Nagoya Municipal Kikuzato High School Music Department , she studied piano , organ , conducting and chamber music under Professor Atsuko Ohori , Professor Both Lehel and Yuzo Toyama at Aichi Prefectural University of Arts and Music .
#Text=During her postgraduate studies in Aichi , her talent was spotted by Professor Jan Ekier , during his visit to Japan .
#Text=They met in Nagoya and Ekier invited her to Warsaw .
#Text=She studied at Chopin Music Academy in Warsaw ( Fryderyk Chopin University of Music in Warsaw ) and gained her diploma in 1994 . [ 1 ]
#Text=First encounter with Professor Jan Ekier
#Text=Ekier visited Japan five times .
#Text=His last visit was early in spring in 1990 .
#Text=He gave Chopin lectures and master-classes all over Japan .
#Text=In 1990 Kawai was studying at Aichi Prefectural University of Arts and Music and attended his lesson in Nagoya .
#Text=She played Chopin 's Sonata in B minor Op.58 .
#Text=After the lesson Ekier immediately told Kawai to come to Poland , to his class at Chopin Music Academy in Warsaw .
#Text=During the Japan tour Ekier had lessons with over 60 pianists , mainly Chopin Competition participants in October 1990 , but only Kawai was invited as his pupil .
#Text=At that time Ekier told the masterclass interpreter about Kawai : " She has great potential .

column1: #Text=A Polish leading music critic Janusz Ekiert wrote about her in his article :
#Text=" She ca n't go to the next round - this is the capital error . "
#Text=" She is the elite of the 13th Chopin Competition but ca n't perform at the Competition any longer .

#Text=Also , in 1991 Kawai obtained Ekier 's book  Introduction to the National Edition " .

column1: #Text=In 2010 Kawai had her own TV programme series ' Yuko Kawai talks about Chopin National Edition ' on CLASSICA JAPAN TV ( vol.1-13 , July – September 2010 ) .
#Text=In 2011 the programme won prestigious Japan Satellite Broadcasting Association Original Programming Awards . [ 5 ]
#Text=Chopinissimo Series
#Text=In 2001 Kawai started her long-term historic project " Yuko Kawai Chopinissimo Series " .
#Text=Playing with historical pianos
#Text=Kawai loves to play Chopin with 19th century pianos .
#Text=She has had a lot of experience to perform and record with historical instruments , e.g. Pleyel 1830 , Pleyel 1842 , Erard 1845 , Pleyel 1846 , Erard 1852 , Erard 1855 and Pleyel 1869 .
#Text=In 2010 Kawai recorded Chopin 's 24 Preludes Op.28 and other pieces at Hamamatsu Museum of Musical Instruments with Pleyel 1830 .
#Text=Recordings
#Text=Kawai has recorded 12 CDs with the BeArTon , PLATZ and IMAGINE label .
#Text=Life in Poland
#Text=She has lived in Poland since 1991 .
#Text=She obtained permanent residence in Poland in 1999 .
#Text=She stays in London occasionally .
